channel.title: python on Dallin Witt
channel.description: Recent content in python on Dallin Witt

item.title: Bokeh: Interactive Visualization of Poverty's Influence on Election Participation and Outcomes
item.description: Synthesized data from a variety of private and governmental resources to draw new and useful conclusions. Used pivoting, joining, and stacking to transform the data into a more helpful and informative structure. Created an interactive dashboard in Bokeh to allow the end-user to better interpret the results. Click here to see the Bokeh plot Link to GitHub repository

item.title: Interactive Visualization of Divvy Bike Movement
item.description: Analyzed gigabytes of data from Divvy Bike to look for trends and patterns. Used lesser-known data visualization tools to represent the information in a more digestible and understandable way. Created an interactive tool that allows the user to see how bikes move between to specific wards in Chicago. Click here to see the interactive diagram Link to GitHub repository

item.title: Neural Network Machine Learning: Loan Repayment Risk Assessment
item.description: Cleaned and validated a very large dataset (>100 attributes, >1,000,000 entries) to prepare it for analysis Used several different neural network models (both classification and regression) to assess risk in different ways. Link to GitHub repository

item.title: Neural Network Machine Learning: Predicting Bikeshare Availability in San Francisco
item.description: Used data from the San Francisco MTA to train a neural network to predict the number of bikes available at a given station at a given time. Used Keras / TensorFlow to create the neural network and SQLite to manage the database. Employed a variety of tools to develop the best possible network, such as randomized search hyperparameter optimization, and k-fold cross validation to ensure statistically robust results.

item.title: Plotly: Interactive Visualization of Politician Approval Ratings during Covid-19
item.description: Used wine survey data from Morning Consult Intelligence and the New York Times Covid data repository to assess the impact that increases in infection and death rates have on the approval ratings of governors and senators. Plotted data using separate tools that were individually highly information dense and highly lay-readable. Click here to see one of the Plotly diagrams Link to GitHub repository

item.title: Supervised Machine Learning: SLC Flight Arrival Classification
item.description: Analyzed multiple ML models and ensembles to find the strongest prediction tool for the task. Iterated over several hyperparameters to find the values that resulted in the strongest predictive power. The final model had a precision of 73% for on time flights, and 69% for late flights. Link to GitHub repository

item.title: Supervised ML Model with Web GUI: Wine Quality Prediction
item.description: Used wine quality data from the UCI Machine Learning Repository to create a ridge regressor that predicts wine quality rating based on chemical and physical properties Used Flask API to create an API for the ML model, then created an HTML frontend for the API. Link to GitHub repository

item.title: Tableau: Educational Attainment in Utah by Sex and Census Tract
item.description: Used data from the Utah state government’s open data catalog. Used tools such as pivoting, stacking, and merging to transform the highly untidy dataset into something that could be used for meaningful insights. Merged the dataset with a GEOJSON file to assign geolocation information to each datum. Visualized the cleaned-up data in a Tableau dashboard, where users can interact with the visualization to extract further insight and information.

item.title: Unsupervised Machine Learning: Clustering Books by Description
item.description: Constructed an unsupervised machine learning algorithm to cluster books based on their descriptions on Goodreads. Analyzed word frequency using a TF-IDF matrix and k means clustering. Examining clusters (shown below) indicated effective and logical clustering. Link to GitHub repository

item.title: Utah Kindergarten MMR Vaccination Analysis
item.description: Used vaccination data from the Utah sate government’s open data catalog, as well as school data from the National Center for Educational Statistics. Used data analysis and visualization tools to show relationships between vaccination rates and school district, poverty, and locale. Link to GitHub repository

item.title: Visualization of Divvy Bike Inflows and Outflows
item.description: Analyzed gigabytes of data from Divvy Bike to look for trends and patterns. Used lesser-known data visualization tools to represent the information in a more digestible and understandable way. Created a diagram that clearly shows the primary origins and destinations of Divvy bikes. Code is easily adaptable to any station. Link to GitHub repository

item.title: Western US Ski Resort Snow Comparison
item.description: Analyzed and plotted time-series data for various locations to determine and plot, in a easily digestible way, median daily values for total snowfall and base depth. Link to GitHub repository
